snippet: Investments in new real estate developments are growing at their slowest pace since 2009, which could have an outsize effect on the economy.
abstract: Economic data indicates that investment in Chinese real estate development has fallen to slowest pace since 2009, and that land purchases by developers are also falling dramatically; while housing prices in China are stabilizing following long decline, glut of unsold and unleased properties have strongly disincentivized new construction, in turn presenting serious problem for economic growth in country.
lead_paragraph: Investments in new real estate developments are growing at their slowest pace since 2009, which could have an outsize effect on the economy.

headline.main: Idle Home Builders Hold China’s Economy Back
headline.print_headline: Idle Property Developers Hold Back the Chinese Economy
